decks.notes: This deck focuses on quickly amassing poison counters on the opponent through the powerful infect mechanic. It utilizes a combination of efficient infect creatures like Glistener Elf and Blighted Agent, along with pump spells like Might of Old Krosa and Mutagenic Growth to deal lethal damage in a single blow. Protection cards like Apostle's Blessing and Spellskite help ensure the creatures can connect with the opponent, while Wild Defiance can pump up the power of the spells being cast. The deck aims to win the game before the opponent has a chance to mount a defense.

The deck focuses on utilizing the Amulet of Vigor to quickly ramp up mana with bounce lands and Primeval Titan to search for powerful lands like Vesuva and Boros Garrison. By efficiently ramping up mana, the deck aims to cast powerful spells like Wurmcoil Engine and Hive Mind to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory through a quick combo finish. The deck also includes protection spells like Pact of Negation and Slaughter Pact to ensure the combo goes off smoothly. Ultimately, the key strategy is to quickly assemble the necessary pieces for a powerful combo win.

The deck focuses on using a variety of control elements to disrupt the opponent's game plan while maintaining card advantage and board presence. This is achieved through a mix of counterspells, removal spells, hand disruption, and powerful planeswalkers. The deck aims to control the early game with cards like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek, then transitions into powerful threats like Tasigur, the Golden Fang and Tarmogoyf for mid to late game dominance. The mana base is carefully constructed to provide the necessary colors while also offering utility lands like Tectonic Edge and Creeping Tar Pit for additional control options.

The main concept of this Abzan Aggro deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan with hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek, while applying pressure with efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf, Siege Rhino, and Tasigur, the Golden Fang. Lingering Souls can provide a strong source of recurring threats and grindy advantage. The deck also includes removal spells like Path to Exile and Abrupt Decay to handle opposing threats. The mana base is designed to support the deck's three-color requirements and provide utility lands like Gavony Township.

This deck focuses on quickly building a board presence with low-cost artifact creatures and utilizing powerful artifact synergies to deal massive damage to the opponent. By efficiently casting spells and utilizing artifact lands and mana-producing artifacts, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with strong creatures like Vault Skirge, Signal Pest, and Arcbound Ravager equipped with Cranial Plating. The deck also includes cards like Thoughtcast to draw more resources and Steel Overseer to pump up its creatures. Overall, this deck aims to win the game quickly through aggressive artifact-based strategies.

The main idea of this deck is to consistently deal damage to the opponent as quickly as possible. It focuses on using cheap burn spells and aggressive creatures to apply pressure early on, while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Skullcrack and Eidolon of the Great Revel. The goal is to end the game swiftly by reducing the opponent's life total to zero before they have a chance to stabilize.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of aggressive Merfolk creatures. By using cards like Aether Vial and Spreading Seas to disrupt the opponent's game plan and maintain a steady stream of creatures on the battlefield, the deck aims to control the tempo of the game and apply pressure early on. Cards like Vapor Snag and Remand provide additional disruption and protection for the Merfolk creatures, allowing them to push through for victory.

The deck focuses on having a fast and aggressive playstyle, utilizing low-cost spells and creatures to pressure the opponent early on. It aims to control the board with counterspells and removal while quickly building a strong board presence with creatures like Delver of Secrets and Young Pyromancer. The deck also features card advantage and flexibility with Snapcaster Mage and Vendilion Clique. The mana base is designed to support playing spells of both blue and red colors efficiently. The deck aims to win the game quickly by overwhelming the opponent with damage and maintaining control of the battlefield.

This Modern Combo deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana using cards like Azusa, Lost but Seeking and Simian Spirit Guide to play Primeval Titan and untap lands multiple times in a turn. The key strategy is to utilize Amulet of Vigor to untap lands whenever a Titan or land enters the battlefield, enabling explosive plays and setting up a win condition with Hive Mind and Summoner's Pact. The deck also includes Pact of Negation for protection and various utility lands like Vesuva and Tolaria West to search for key pieces. Overall, the deck aims to assemble the Amulet Titan combo and overwhelm opponents with powerful ramp and land recursion.

The deck focuses on fast and aggressive plays, using burn spells and efficient creatures to deal damage quickly to the opponent. With a low mana curve and a high density of direct damage spells, the deck aims to apply constant pressure and close out the game before the opponent can stabilize. Cards like Monastery Swiftspear and Goblin Guide provide early aggression, while burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Spike finish off the opponent. The deck also includes spells like Searing Blaze and Skullcrack to disrupt the opponent's game plan and prevent them from gaining life or stabilizing.

This aggro deck aims to deal damage quickly and efficiently to the opponent, utilizing burn spells like Rift Bolt, Lava Spike, and Lightning Bolt along with creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear. The deck also includes cards to prevent the opponent from gaining life or stabilizing, such as Skullcrack and Boros Charm. With a low mana curve and consistent damage output, this deck seeks to win the game as fast as possible before the opponent can establish their own game plan.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly build up a powerful creature, such as Glistener Elf or Blighted Agent, and use various pump spells such as Might of Old Krosa and Mutagenic Growth to give it infect damage. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with poison counters before they can effectively defend against the quick and lethal strikes from the infect creatures. The deck also includes protection spells like Apostle's Blessing and Wild Defiance to ensure the infect creatures can get through to deal damage.

The main concept of this deck is to use the combo of Splinter Twin along with Deceiver Exarch or Pestermite to create infinite creature tokens with haste. The deck also includes protection cards like Spellskite and Pact of Negation to ensure the combo goes off successfully. Blood Moon is included to disrupt opponents' mana bases, while cards like Sleight of Hand and Serum Visions help with card selection and consistency. The deck aims to assemble the combo quickly and efficiently to overwhelm the opponent and secure the win.

The deck focuses on assembling the Twin combo pieces, Splinter Twin and Deceiver Exarch or Pestermite, to create infinite creature tokens and win the game. It also includes card draw, counterspells, and removal to control the board and protect the combo. The deck aims to quickly assemble the combo pieces while disrupting the opponent's game plan, utilizing the flexibility of Snapcaster Mage to reuse key cards and maintain consistency. Additionally, it includes some utility creatures like Vendilion Clique for additional card advantage and disruption.

The main concept of this deck is to assemble the Splinter Twin combo with either Pestermite or Deceiver Exarch in order to create an infinite loop of hasty token creatures. The deck also includes control elements such as counterspells and removal spells to protect the combo. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Blood Moon can disrupt opponent's mana bases, while cards like Vendilion Clique and Snapcaster Mage provide additional utility and card advantage. The deck aims to control the game until it can safely assemble and protect the combo for a game-winning play.
